alert.note: Alert for Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 4:52PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wyoming, including locations around Cody, WY in the following county, Park. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 451 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in a short period of time. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Crazy Quilt Reservoir Drain, Black Spring Drain, Eagle Pass Draw, Idaho Creek, Sulphur Creek, Indian Pass Draw, Sage Creek, Spring Creek, Whistle Creek Reservoir Drain, East Fork Sulphur Creek, Oregon Basin Drain, Whistle Creek, Corbett Dam Draw, North Dry Gulch, Dry Creek, Bitter Creek, West Branch Whistle Creek, Shoshone River, Diamond Creek, Back Scratcher Reservoir Drain and Deer Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Cody and Buffalo Bill State Park.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
